articles.title: ESA to accelerate space use for climate impacts - Smart Energy
articles.description: The European Space Agency (ESA) has introduced three ‘accelerators’ to drive the increased use of space for the climate ‘crisis’.
articles.content:
The European Space Agency (ESA) has introduced three accelerators to drive the increased use of space for the climate crisis.
These are Space for a green future, Rapid and resilient crisis response … [+2801 chars]

articles.title: 'You are not alone': EU Parliament delegation tells Taiwan on first official visit - Reuters
articles.description: The European Parliament's first official delegation to Taiwan said on Thursday the diplomatically isolated island is not alone and called for bolder actions to strengthen EU-Taiwan ties as Taipei faces rising pressure from Beijing.
articles.content: Raphael Glucksmann, leader of the opposition Parti Socialiste and Place Publique (Socialist Party and Public Place) list for the European elections, attends a rally in Lyon, France May 16, 2019. REUT… [+2336 chars]

articles.title: Strong Solar Flare Could Trigger Auroras on Earth – In Time for Diwali in India - The Wire Science
articles.description: A strong solar flare erupted earlier this week that could affect GPS and communication satellites in the coming days, and also cause auroras in Europe and North America.
articles.content:
Representative image: The Sun emitting a significant solar flare in December 2014. Image: NASA Solar Dynamics Observatory
